column4: I'm trying to install ubuntu, why after adding an ext3 partition for / the rest of the space becomes "unusable" so I can't create swap ?
no, just using the installed interface for creating partitions
(I don't really know whats LVM, but I guess it means I'm not messing with it)
nope
ater adding 1 partition it won't let me add any other ones, the rest of the space becomes unusable
I'm just using the normal livecd installer
nope
it has windows on it
3 partitions
the weird thing is that it worked for
create an extended partition with 2 logical volumes in it, one for your / and one for swap

I have there some weird 4194mb fat32 partition

if it's a brand-name like HP/Compaq/Dell that may contain extra (bios) tools
